intro: Schoenoplectiella confusa subsp. natalitia, commonly known as Natal sedge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and ecological studies.
